trans-unit.source: Contains information about the reason that a workflow instance was suspended.

> [!NOTE] > [!INCLUDE[DeprecatedContent](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md)] A TrackingWorkflowSuspendedEventArgs is generated by the runtime tracking infrastructure when a workflow instance is suspended.

If the <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.TrackingProfile> associated with a workflow instance includes a <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.WorkflowTrackPoint> configured for a <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.TrackingWorkflowEvent>, then the workflow tracking infrastructure puts a TrackingWorkflowSuspendedEventArgs in <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.WorkflowTrackingRecord.EventArgs%2A> in the <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.WorkflowTrackingRecord> that it sends to the Tracking service.
> [!NOTE] > TrackingWorkflowSuspendedEventArgs is used only by the runtime tracking service to pass information in a <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.WorkflowTrackingRecord>.
The data for a <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.WorkflowRuntime.WorkflowSuspended?displayProperty=fullName> event is passed in a <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.WorkflowSuspendedEventArgs>.
Contains information about the reason that a workflow instance was suspended.

This can come from the <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.WorkflowInstance.Suspend*> (string error) or the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.SuspendActivity.Error*> property that you set on the <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.SuspendActivity"></xref> activity.
String value that contains the reason that a workflow instance was suspended.
